metadata.title: CVE-2022-22760 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
[Unknown description]

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-22760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.7.0+build2-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
